dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: ...so wait, the UAPF, like, transferred over eight million dollars, but to adults? For a program called "National Fund for Children"? That just, uh, doesn't make sense to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so wait, the U A P F, like, transferred over eight million dollars, but to adults? For a program called National Fund for Children? That just, uh, doesn't make sense to me.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unified Accumulative Pension Fund (UAPF) transferred more than $8 million to adult participants within the framework of the "National Fund for Children" program.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no, I get why that sounds, you know, a bit confusing at first glance. But it's about, um, target savings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, I get why that sounds, you know, a bit confusing at first glance. But it's about, um, target savings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Target savings? For kids, but adults are getting it? I'm just, like, really lost here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Target savings? For kids, but adults are getting it? I'm just, like, really lost here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so these are funds set aside, and when the children, um, become adults, they can access these savings. It's their money then, essentially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so these are funds set aside, and when the children, um, become adults, they can access these savings. It's their money then, essentially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unified Accumulative Pension Fund (UAPF) transferred more than $8 million to adult participants within the framework of the "National Fund for Children" program.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, okay, I think I'm starting to follow. So, they can just, like, take all of it out? Or just some?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay, I think I'm starting to follow. So, they can just, like, take all of it out? Or just some?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Good question. They actually have the right to use the entire amount, or just a part of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question. They actually have the right to use the entire amount, or just a part of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is noted that the recipient of target savings (TS) has the right to use the entire amount or part of it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: And what happens to, like, the money they don't use? Does it just disappear or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And what happens to, like, the money they don't use? Does it just disappear or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. Any unused amount can stay right there in their target savings account, their TSA. It's pretty flexible, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. Any unused amount can stay right there in their target savings account, their T S A. It's pretty flexible, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The remainder of the unused amount can be saved in the target savings account (TSA).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Okay. And then it says, uh, March 1st, 2025, but also February 1st, 2024. That's, um, an interesting timeline. What's going on there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Okay. And then it says, uh, March first, twenty twenty five, but also February first, twenty twenty four. That's, um, an interesting timeline. What's going on there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: That's just the reporting period, you know? It's saying as of March 1st, 2025, these numbers account for transfers that have happened since February 2024.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just the reporting period, you know? It's saying as of March first, twenty twenty five, these numbers account for transfers that have happened since February twenty twenty four.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of March 1, 2025, since February 1, 2024, 75,329 applications for more than $8 million have been executed...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I see. So, cumulatively, then. And it says over seventy-five thousand applications were processed for, like, over eight million. What were people using this money for?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I see. So, cumulatively, then. And it says over seventy-five thousand applications were processed for, like, over eight million. What were people using this money for?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of March 1, 2025, since February 1, 2024, 75,329 applications for more than $8 million have been executed...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, a big chunk, about forty-three thousand applications and over four-point-six-five million dollars, was for improving housing conditions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, a big chunk, about forty-three thousand applications and over four-point-six-five million dollars, was for improving housing conditions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Of these, 43,781 applications for more than $4.65 million were executed for the purpose of improving housing conditions...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: The other almost thirty-two thousand applications, for around three-point-three-five million, that was for, um, paying for education.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The other almost thirty-two thousand applications, for around three-point-three-five million, that was for, um, paying for education.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and 31,548 applications for about $3.35 million were executed for paying for education," the report says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: So, two main things, really. Got it. And then, uh, there's this bit at the end about Kazakhstan creating a new credit guarantee fund for large businesses. Is that, like, related to the UAPF stuff?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, two main things, really. Got it. And then, uh, there's this bit at the end about Kazakhstan creating a new credit guarantee fund for large businesses. Is that, like, related to the U A P F stuff?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Economy Serik Zhumangarin announced that Kazakhstan will create a new credit guarantee fund for large businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, no, that's actually a completely separate announcement. That's from the Deputy Prime Minister about, like, a new fund for businesses, not, uh, the individual savings we've been discussing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, no, that's actually a completely separate announcement. That's from the Deputy Prime Minister about, like, a new fund for businesses, not, uh, the individual savings we've been discussing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Economy Serik Zhumangarin announced that Kazakhstan will create a new credit guarantee fund for large businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally different thing then. I, uh, got a little sidetracked there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally different thing then. I, uh, got a little sidetracked there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Happens. Easy to, you know, conflate news items when they're in the same report.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Happens. Easy to, you know, conflate news items when they're in the same report.
